newsitem.title: USA: Illinois TIF reforms plan shelved until summer.
newsitem.headline: Illinois TIF reforms plan shelved until summer.

text.p: Illinois legislation to change the state's tax increment financing law will not be heard this session, but will be held for hearings over the summer, a spokeswoman for the Senate Republican caucus said Thursday.
Legislative leaders wanted more information on the complex issue and may reintroduce a plan during the fall veto session, spokeswoman Sharon Brown said.
The legislation supported by the Illinois Tax Increment Association included a provision to discourage the use fof TIF to induce retailers to leave one community for a neighboring community.

The plan also would prohibit the use of tax increment revenues for the cost of building new municipal public buildings and require municipalities to include a provision for affordable housing and assistance in relocating where housing will be demolished for a TIF district.
